alert.note: Alert for Rockwall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 26 at 1:21PM CDT until April 29 at 11:48AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Dallas and Rockwall. * WHEN...Until 315 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dallas, Garland, Irving, Mesquite, Carrollton, Richardson, Rowlett, Wylie, Rockwall, Farmers Branch, Balch Springs, University Park, Sachse, Seagoville, Addison, Highland Park, Hutchins, Cockrell Hill, Heath and Sunnyvale.
